content.html:
In this lesson, you learned how to:

  • Find missing terms in a geometric sequence.

Here are the activities that helped you reach those goals:

  • 4.14.1: What Are the Patterns?
    • In this activity, you noticed and wondered about the patterns and characteristics of different sequences. 
  • 4.14.2: Using Tables and Graphs to Represent Geometric Sequences
    • In this activity, you used tables and graphs to recognize a sequence and find the next term. You learned that geometric sequences can get larger or smaller.
  • 4.14.2: Self Check 
  • 4.14.3: Complete the Sequence
    • In this activity, you worked to complete the geometric sequences by filling in the blanks. You used a common ratio to find the pattern to complete the sequence.
  • 4.14.3: Self Check 
  • 4.14.4: Connecting the Common Ratio and the Term in a Sequence
    • In this activity, you summarized what you learned in the lesson by explaining why a sequence is geometric and how you are able to find the next term.

After these activities, you completed the following practice:

  • 4.14.5: Practice

Checking In

On a scale of 1 to 5, how confident do you feel about the learning goals of this lesson?

Correct!

If you’ve answered 3 or less, be sure to reach out to your teacher before starting the next lesson.
